channel.title: O hai
channel.description:
anyone remember me? ;]
Ok. As a select few of you may know, my bot is currently in a stage of FANTASTICISM. The only big problems right now are:
- I can't get the client image without Robot - It takes literarily seconds to convert an Image to IColor[][] ( basically a Color[][] )
So, if anyone has tips/snips/free cookies for me, feel free to post.

item.title: O hai
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:

Seeing that Ruler has an inside on it, I guess they combined forces

Heresy!

item.title: O hai
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:13, topic:61794”][quote author=ruler link=topic=89152.msg954150#msg954150 date=1172807289]

anyone remember me? ;]

Ok. As a select few of you may know, my bot is currently in a stage of FANTASTICISM.
The only big problems right now are:

  • I can’t get the client image without Robot
  • It takes literarily seconds to convert an Image to IColor[][] ( basically a Color[][] )

So, if anyone has tips/snips/free cookies for me, feel free to post.

Why not wait for System X?

Why not think before you talk.

hey i am just saying he could just wait for system x 's color base.
[/quote]
How would you know whether System X will have a color base unless Taios let you in on her HUX?
Plus, ARGA is meant to be a bytecode bot, not a color-clicker like FagBot[/quote]
I was bored and wanted to make a color base as well The more hax the better. I told ruler that System X will have color stuffs.

Oh, and ruler + us != joined forces

item.title: O hai
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“Chrisface, post:6, topic:61794”]It seems you’re doing the exact same thing as i am but i’m just a fair bit ahead of you because mine is nearly fully operational but with very few fancy bits.

I’m using Robot as well but it’s been very fast for me but i’m doing it a little differently. Use Robot to get a BufferedImage of the area you want to watch and then use BufferedImages int[] getRGB() function. That returns an array of the rgb values of type TYPE_INT_ARGB. Then all you have to do is search through the array for your matching colour. I don’t know what type your saving your colours in but you’ll likely have to do a conversion somewhere so make sure you convert it in the right place for best speed. You don’t want to go and convert every colour in the array when you can just convert the colour you’re searching for once. I’m going to be posting my source soon when i get this damned threading working for when it runs scripts. Right now once you’ve started the script you can’t stop it lol.[/quote]

you fucking shit I had the bot completed weeks before I posted this. I think youre the one in need of my help.

Ty guys, iamadam, frank. <3

Read full topic

item.title: O hai
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:7, topic:61794”]Do what regecks` told you to do Uhh, I’m feeling nice so I’ll share some of my hax:

There is a nice little abstract class somewhere in the client. It has two subclasses, one of which contains a ‘Component’ field. Inside that subclass is a method which takes a graphics object. Make that method paint to your graphics object instead of theirs. I havn’t tested it much, but it’s worked fine so far.[/quote]or instead of painting to your object, steal their pixel array

Read full topic

item.title: O hai
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

it is so exciting to see so many following in my foot steps. much love all

Read full topic

item.title: O hai
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Do what regecks` told you to do Uhh, I’m feeling nice so I’ll share some of my hax:

There is a nice little abstract class somewhere in the client. It has two subclasses, one of which contains a ‘Component’ field. Inside that subclass is a method which takes a graphics object. Make that method paint to your graphics object instead of theirs. I havn’t tested it much, but it’s worked fine so far.

Read full topic

item.title: O hai
item.dc:creator: @Chrisface Chrisface
item.description:
@Chrisface wrote:

It seems you’re doing the exact same thing as i am but i’m just a fair bit ahead of you because mine is nearly fully operational but with very few fancy bits.

I’m using Robot as well but it’s been very fast for me but i’m doing it a little differently. Use Robot to get a BufferedImage of the area you want to watch and then use BufferedImages int[] getRGB() function. That returns an array of the rgb values of type TYPE_INT_ARGB. Then all you have to do is search through the array for your matching colour. I don’t know what type your saving your colours in but you’ll likely have to do a conversion somewhere so make sure you convert it in the right place for best speed. You don’t want to go and convert every colour in the array when you can just convert the colour you’re searching for once. I’m going to be posting my source soon when i get this damned threading working for when it runs scripts. Right now once you’ve started the script you can’t stop it lol.

Read full topic
